Behaviour Support Services

Comprehensive, evidence-based behaviour support delivered under professional supervision

How I Can Help

I provide comprehensive behaviour support services to NDIS participants, families, and support teams across Australia. All services are delivered under professional supervision, ensuring the highest quality of care while my NDIS registration is under assessment through the Alternate Pathway.

Functional Behaviour Assessment

Understanding behaviour to create effective support strategies

A comprehensive Functional Behaviour Assessment (FBA) is the foundation of effective behaviour support. I use evidence-based assessment tools and collaborative approaches to understand why behaviours occur and what maintains them.

What's Included:

  • Comprehensive Information Gathering: Review of relevant reports, plans, and documentation
  • Stakeholder Interviews: Conversations with participants, families, and support teams
  • Direct Observation: Structured observations in relevant environments
  • Data Collection: Systematic recording of behaviour patterns and contexts
  • Functional Analysis: Identifying triggers, functions, and maintaining factors
  • Report Development: Detailed assessment report with recommendations

Benefits:

Clear understanding of behaviour patterns
Evidence-based recommendations
Foundation for effective support planning
Collaborative stakeholder involvement

Assessment Process:

1

Initial Consultation

Free 30-minute discussion to understand your needs

2

Information Gathering

Comprehensive review of documentation and interviews

3

Direct Assessment

Observations and data collection in relevant settings

4

Report & Recommendations

Detailed assessment report with practical recommendations

üìã

Behaviour Support Plan Development

Creating comprehensive, individualized support plans

I develop comprehensive Behaviour Support Plans (BSPs) that align with NDIS requirements and focus on improving quality of life while addressing behaviours of concern through positive, evidence-based strategies.

What's Included:

  • Person-Centered Planning: Focus on individual goals, preferences, and strengths
  • Proactive Strategies: Environmental modifications and skill-building approaches
  • Reactive Strategies: Safe and dignified responses to behaviours of concern
  • Skill Development: Teaching alternative behaviours and life skills
  • Restrictive Practice Documentation: If required, comprehensive restrictive practice assessments
  • Implementation Guidelines: Clear, practical guidance for support teams

My Approach:

üéØ

Strength-Based

Building on individual capabilities and interests

üè†

Quality of Life Focus

Improving overall wellbeing and life satisfaction

ü§ù

Collaborative

Working closely with all stakeholders

üìä

Evidence-Based

Using proven strategies and interventions

ü§ù

Implementation Support

Ensuring effective plan implementation and positive outcomes

Successful behaviour support requires effective implementation. I provide ongoing coaching, training, and support to ensure Behaviour Support Plans are implemented consistently and effectively across all environments.

What's Included:

  • Team Training: Comprehensive training for support workers and family members
  • Coaching Sessions: Regular coaching to build confidence and competence
  • Progress Monitoring: Systematic tracking of plan effectiveness
  • Plan Reviews: Regular reviews and adjustments as needed
  • Crisis Support: Additional support during challenging periods
  • Documentation Support: Assistance with data collection and reporting

Types of Implementation Support:

Initial Implementation

Intensive support during the first 4-6 weeks of plan implementation

Ongoing Coaching

Regular check-ins and coaching sessions to maintain effectiveness

Refresher Training

Periodic training updates for new team members or skill refreshers

Emergency Consultation

Additional support available for crisis situations or urgent needs

Specialized Support Areas

Additional expertise in complex support needs

Complex Communication Needs

Supporting individuals with limited verbal communication using AAC and alternative strategies

Dual Diagnosis

Behaviour support for individuals with both disability and mental health considerations

Transition Support

Supporting individuals through major life transitions (school to adult services, housing changes, etc.)

Forensic Disability

Specialized support for individuals with disability involved in the justice system
